abstract: A collection of container values associated with a given view.
overview:
## Overview

SwiftUI exposes a collection of values associated with each view in the `ContainerValues` structure.

Container values you set on a given view affect only that view. Like preferences, container values are able to be read by views above the view they’re set on. Unlike preferences, however, container values don’t have merging behavior because they don’t escape their closest container. In the following example, the container value is set on the contained view, but is dropped when it reaches the containing [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/VStack].

Even if a stack has only one child, container values still won’t be readable outside of the `VStack`. Container values don’t escape a container even if the container has only one child.

In this example, a direct subview writes a container value, allowing its direct container view to read it back:

However in the next example, the wrapping `VStack` means the `Text` view is not a direct subview of the outer container, so that container cannot read the changed value:

Create a custom container value by declaring a new property in an extension to the container values structure and applying the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Entry()] macro to the variable declaration:

Clients of your value then access the value by reading it from the container values collection of a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Subview].

Related pieces of container configuration can also be grouped under the same container values key.

This allows you to group multiple related container values into structs while maintaining separate modifiers to write each value.

items.description: Returns true if the container values contain a tag matching a given value.
items.name: hasTag(_:)

items.description: The tag value for the given type if the container values contains one.
items.name: tag(for:)

items.description: Accesses the particular container value associated with a custom key.
items.name: subscript(_:)

items.description: An opaque value representing a subview of another view.
items.name: Subview

items.description: An opaque collection representing the subviews of view.
items.name: SubviewsCollection

items.description: Sets a particular container value of a view.
items.name: containerValue(_:_:)

items.description: A key for accessing container values.
items.name: ContainerValueKey

title: ContainerValues
